text: The Seuna, Sevuna or Yadavs of Devagiri was an Indian dynasty, that existed from the mid-9th to mid 14th century. At its peak, the kingdom stretched from the Tungabhadra to the Narmada rivers, including present-day Maharashtra, north Karnataka and parts of Madhya Pradesh. The capital was at Devagiri (present-day Daulatabad in Maharashtra). The Yadavas initially ruled as feudatories of the Western Chalukyas. Around the middle of the 12th century, they declared independence and established independence that reached its peak under Singhana II. Bhillama V (1185â€“93) moved their capital from Sinnar, near Nashik, to Devagiri. ==List of Rulers== *Dridhaprahara *Seunachandra *Dhadiyappa *Bhillama I *Rajugi *Vaddiga *Dhadiyasa *Bhillama II *Vesugi I *Bhillama III *Vesugi II alias Vaddiga or Yadugi *Seunachandra II *Airammadeva or Erammadeva *Simhana I *Obscure rulers *Mallugi I *Amaragangeya *Amara- mallugi alias Mallugi II *Bhillama V *Jaitugi I *Simhana II *Krishna alias Kannara *Mahadeva *Ammana *Ramachandra alias Ramadeva *Simhana III alias Shankaradeva *Harapaladeva == References == Category:Yadav Category:9th- century establishments in Asia Category:850s establishments Category:14th- century disestablishments in Asia Category:1310s disestablishments Category:History of India
title: Seuna (Yadava) Dynasty
